rationale: Replace the final grouping operator with group_neutralize to remove industry-level biases before ranking, ensuring the signal is interpreted within industry cohorts.
expression: combined_cashflow = (0.64 * cashflow_op / cap + 0.36 * est_fcf / cap); alpha = ts_quantile(combined_cashflow, 57, driver = "gaussian"); group_neutralize(alpha, industry);

rationale: Lower the look-back window from 57 to 30 days to capture more recent momentum in cash-flow yields and reduce potential lag in the signal.
expression: combined_cashflow = (0.64 * cashflow_op / cap + 0.36 * est_fcf / cap); alpha = ts_quantile(combined_cashflow, 30, driver = "gaussian"); group_rank(alpha, industry);

rationale: Introduce a 10-day smoothing (ts_mean) before the quantile transform to reduce noise and stabilize the signal, potentially improving robustness.
expression: combined_cashflow = (0.64 * cashflow_op / cap + 0.36 * est_fcf / cap); alpha = ts_quantile(ts_mean(combined_cashflow, 10), 57, driver = "gaussian"); group_rank(alpha, industry);

rationale: Replace ts_quantile with ts_zscore to standardize the signal based on its time-series distribution, offering an alternative normalization that emphasizes deviations from the recent mean.
expression: combined_cashflow = (0.64 * cashflow_op / cap + 0.36 * est_fcf / cap); alpha = ts_zscore(combined_cashflow, 57); group_rank(alpha, industry);

rationale: Replace the grouping with group_max to amplify the strongest within-industry signals by taking the maximum alpha value among peers, yielding a more aggressive intra-industry tilt.
expression: combined_cashflow = (0.64 * cashflow_op / cap + 0.36 * est_fcf / cap); alpha = ts_quantile(combined_cashflow, 57, driver = "gaussian"); group_max(alpha, industry);
